contributors: ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, Caliph, approximately 600-661.
item.title: Zubūr Āl Muḥammad.
notes: Paper; very thin off white laid paper with no visible chain lines of watermarks; pages have outer ruled border of two thin black lines; text within a border of a gold band; floral unwan in blue, gold, and red; Arabic text in black ink, with interlinear Persian translation in red ink; marginal notes and corrections; catchwords.
Brockelmann. GAL, GI, p. 144; SI, p. 76
Naskh (Arabic), Nastaʻliq (Persian); 24 lines in written area 8 x 3.7 cm.
Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, M148.
Binding;  lacquer on boards; morocco leather spine; multicolor floral design on black lacquer; red paper pastedowns with gold floral design and border.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
summary: Collection of doxologies and prayers, ascribed to ʻAlī or to his grandson Zayn al-ʻĀbidin ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn
medium: 175 leaves (24 lines), paper : bound ; 12.5 x 8 cm
other_title: Zābūr Āl Muḥammad, 1064 A.H., Ad'iyah wa-mawāiẓ
